import * as React from "react"
import * as SliderPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-slider"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Slider = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <SliderPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative flex w-full touch-none select-none items-center",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <SliderPrimitive.Track className="relative h-2 w-full grow overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary">
      <SliderPrimitive.Range className="absolute h-full bg-primary" />
    </SliderPrimitive.Track>
    <SliderPrimitive.Thumb className="block h-5 w-5 rounded-full border-2 border-primary bg-background ring-offset-background transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50" />
  </SliderPrimitive.Root>
))
Slider.displayName = SliderPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Slider }

design_guidelines.md.content:
# Design Guidelines: Shelf-Aid Stock Control System

## Design Approach

**System**: Material Design principles combined with Linear's clean aesthetic for a modern, data-focused inventory management application. This approach prioritizes clarity, efficiency, and scannable information architecture for daily operational use.

**Design Philosophy**: Professional utility tool with emphasis on data visibility, quick actions, and clear feedback mechanisms. Every interaction should feel immediate and purposeful.

---

## Typography System

**Font Family**: 
- Primary: Inter (via Google Fonts CDN)
- Monospace: JetBrains Mono (for codes, dates, numerical data)

**Type Scale**:
- Page Headers: text-3xl font-bold (dashboard titles)
- Section Headers: text-2xl font-semibold (card/panel titles)
- Subsections: text-lg font-medium (table headers, form sections)
- Body Text: text-base font-normal (form labels, descriptions)
- Data Display: text-sm font-medium (table cells, badges)
- Meta Information: text-xs (timestamps, helper text)
- Numerical Data: tabular-nums class for alignment

---

## Layout System

**Spacing Primitives**: Tailwind units of 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16 (e.g., p-4, gap-6, mb-8)

**Container Structure**:
- Sidebar Navigation: Fixed width 16rem (w-64), full height with subtle border-right
- Main Content Area: flex-1 with max-width constraint of max-w-7xl, centered with mx-auto
- Content Padding: p-6 on mobile, p-8 on desktop
- Card Spacing: gap-6 for grid layouts, mb-8 for vertical stacking

**Grid Patterns**:
- Dashboard Cards: grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 with gap-6
- Data Tables: Full-width with horizontal scroll on mobile
- Forms: Single column max-w-2xl for optimal readability

---

## Component Library

### Navigation Components

**Sidebar Navigation**:
- Fixed left sidebar with company logo/app name at top (p-6)
- Navigation items: Full-width buttons with icon + label, rounded-lg, p-3
- Active state: Distinct background, slightly bolder font weight
- Sections grouped with text-xs uppercase labels (mb-2, mt-6)
- User profile section at bottom with avatar, name, role

**Top Bar** (if needed for secondary actions):
- h-16 with flex items-center justify-between
- Search bar (if applicable): max-w-md
- Quick action buttons and user menu on right

### Form Components

**Input Fields**:
- Consistent height: h-11 for all text inputs
- Border radius: rounded-lg
- Label above input: text-sm font-medium mb-2
- Helper text below: text-xs mt-1
- Error states: Red border, error message with icon
- Required indicator: Asterisk in label

**Password Field Special**:
- Toggle visibility icon button positioned absolute right-3
- Icon changes between eye/eye-off (Heroicons)
- Maintains same height as standard input

**Date Inputs**:
- Native date picker with custom styling to match design system
- Display current date prominently as placeholder/default
- Format: DD/MM/YYYY (Brazilian standard)

**File Upload (Excel Import)**:
- Drag-and-drop zone: min-h-48, dashed border, centered content
- File icon (Heroicons: document-arrow-up) with text
- Accepted formats clearly displayed: "Aceita arquivos .xlsx, .xls"
- Upload progress bar when processing

**Email Validation**:
- Real-time validation indicator (checkmark/X icon)
- Visual feedback on blur with animation
- Clear error messaging: "Digite um email vlido"

### Data Display Components

**Food Items Table**:
- Sticky header: sticky top-0
- Alternating row subtle background
- Columns: Code (monospace font), Description, Fabrication Date, Expiration Date, Quantity, Actions
- Compact row height: h-14
- Action column: Icon buttons (edit, delete) with gap-2

**History/Audit Log**:
- Timeline view OR table view toggle
- Each entry shows: timestamp (relative + absolute), user, action type (badge), old/new values
- Action badges: Distinct visual treatment (Entrada = green accent, Sada = red accent, Edio = blue accent, Excluso = gray accent)
- Expandable rows for detailed changes

**Statistics Cards**:
- Grid layout on dashboard
- Card structure: p-6, rounded-xl, shadow-sm
- Large number display: text-4xl font-bold
- Label below: text-sm
- Trend indicator: Small arrow icon with percentage

### Action Components

**Primary CTA Buttons**:
- Height: h-11
- Padding: px-6
- Border radius: rounded-lg
- Font: text-sm font-semibold
- Icons: 20px Heroicons, mr-2 spacing
- States: Default, hover (slight scale/shadow increase), active, disabled

**Secondary Buttons**:
- Same dimensions as primary
- Border: 1.5px solid
- Background: Transparent

**Icon Buttons** (table actions, toggles):
- Size: h-9 w-9
- Rounded: rounded-lg
- Icon size: 18px
- Hover: Subtle background

**Export Button**:
- Icon: Heroicons arrow-down-tray
- Positioned top-right of data table
- Secondary button style
- Shows loading spinner during export generation

### Modal/Dialog Components

**Authentication Modals**:
- Login: Centered modal, max-w-md, p-8
- Logo/app name at top (text-center, mb-8)
- Form fields with mb-4 spacing
- "Esqueci minha senha" link below password: text-sm, right-aligned
- Submit button: Full width, mt-6

**Password Recovery Modal**:
- Similar structure to login
- Email input with validation
- Clear instructions: text-sm mb-6
- Success message with checkmark icon after submission

**Confirmation Dialogs** (delete actions):
- max-w-sm, centered
- Warning icon (Heroicons: exclamation-triangle)
- Clear title: text-lg font-semibold
- Description: text-sm
- Action buttons: Cancel (secondary) + Confirm (primary danger)

**Import/Export Modals**:
- Import: File upload area + field mapping preview
- Export: Options checkboxes + format selection + generate button
- Progress indicator during processing
- Success state with download button

### Notification Components

**Toast Messages**:
- Fixed position: bottom-right
- Width: max-w-sm
- Auto-dismiss after 5 seconds
- Types: Success (checkmark icon), Error (X icon), Info (info icon), Warning (exclamation)
- Animation: Slide in from right, fade out

---

## Page-Specific Layouts

### Dashboard (Home)
- Statistics cards grid at top: 3-column on desktop
- Recent activity timeline
- Quick actions panel (Add Item, Import, Export)
- Low stock alerts section

### Food Database Page
- Search bar + filters row (mb-6)
- Add New Item button (top-right)
- Data table with pagination
- Bulk actions toolbar when items selected

### History/Audit Page
- Date range selector at top
- Filter by action type (chips/pills)
- Timeline or table view toggle
- Export audit log button

### Authentication Pages
- Full-screen centered layout
- max-w-md container
- Subtle background pattern or gradient
- Login form with password toggle
- Link to password recovery
- Registration form (if applicable) with email validation

---

## Responsive Behavior

**Mobile (< 768px)**:
- Sidebar collapses to bottom navigation bar or hamburger menu
- Tables scroll horizontally with shadow indicators
- Cards stack to single column
- Forms maintain max-w-full
- Action buttons full-width on mobile

**Tablet (768px - 1024px)**:
- Sidebar remains visible
- 2-column grid for dashboard cards
- Tables remain full-width with better spacing

**Desktop (> 1024px)**:
- Full sidebar navigation
- 3-column layouts for cards
- Optimal spacing and readability

---

## Icons

**Library**: Heroicons (via CDN) - use outline style for navigation, solid for indicators

**Key Icons**:
- Navigation: home, cube, clock-rotate-left, document-text, cog-6-tooth
- Actions: plus, pencil, trash, arrow-down-tray, arrow-up-tray
- Status: check-circle, x-circle, exclamation-triangle, information-circle
- UI: magnifying-glass, eye, eye-slash, x-mark, bars-3

---

## Micro-interactions

**Minimal Animation Policy**:
- Button hover: Subtle scale (scale-105) and shadow increase
- Form validation: Icon fade-in with checkmark/X
- Table row hover: Background change only
- Modal entry: Fade + slight scale (0.95 to 1)
- Toast notifications: Slide-in animation only
- NO scroll-triggered animations
- NO loading skeletons unless data takes > 2 seconds

---

## Accessibility

- All form inputs have associated labels
- Error messages announced to screen readers
- Keyboard navigation throughout
- Focus indicators on all interactive elements (ring-2 ring-offset-2)
- ARIA labels for icon buttons
- Sufficient contrast ratios maintained
- Skip to main content link

replit.md.content:
# Shelf-Aid Stock Control System

## Overview

Shelf-Aid is a comprehensive food inventory management system designed for warehouse and stock control. The application tracks food products with detailed information including batch numbers, expiration dates, temperature requirements, and shelf life. It features automated alerts for expiring products, audit logging for all operations, and bulk import capabilities via Excel files.

The system is built for the Prieto company ("Prieto - Controle de Alimentos desde 1968") and emphasizes data visibility, quick actions, and clear feedback mechanisms for inventory management.

## User Preferences

Preferred communication style: Simple, everyday language.

## System Architecture

### Frontend Architecture

**Framework**: React 18 with TypeScript, using Vite as the build tool and development server

**UI Framework**: shadcn/ui component library built on Radix UI primitives with Tailwind CSS for styling

**Design System**: Material Design principles combined with Linear's clean aesthetic, emphasizing:
- Typography: Inter font for UI, JetBrains Mono for numerical/code data
- Spacing: Tailwind's standardized spacing scale (2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16)
- Custom color tokens using HSL with CSS variables for theme consistency
- "New York" shadcn style variant with custom border radii (9px, 6px, 3px)

**State Management**: 
- TanStack Query (React Query) for server state and data fetching
- React Hook Form with Zod validation for form state
- Local React state for UI interactions

**Routing**: Wouter for lightweight client-side routing

**Key Features**:
- Protected routes with session-based authentication
- Excel import/export functionality using xlsx library
- Real-time computed fields (expiration status, alerts, weight calculations)
- Collapsible list views for detailed product information
- Audit log tracking all CRUD operations

### Backend Architecture

**Framework**: Express.js with TypeScript running on Node.js

**API Design**: RESTful API with session-based authentication

**Authentication**: 
- bcrypt for password hashing
- express-session with MemoryStore for session management
- Session cookies with 7-day expiration
- Protected middleware for route authorization

**Data Access Layer**: Storage abstraction pattern (IStorage interface) implemented by DatabaseStorage class, enabling:
- Clean separation between business logic and data persistence
- Testability through interface-based design
- Centralized data operations for users, products (alimentos), and audit logs

**Development Server**: Custom Vite integration for HMR in development with middleware mode

**Build Process**: 
- Client: Vite builds React app to `dist/public`
- Server: esbuild bundles Express app to `dist/index.js`

### Data Storage

**Database**: PostgreSQL via Neon serverless

**ORM**: Drizzle ORM with type-safe schema definitions

**Schema Design**:

1. **users** table:
   - UUID primary keys
   - Email-based authentication
   - Password reset token support
   - Timestamp tracking

2. **alimentos** (products) table:
   - Auto-incrementing integer IDs
   - Product tracking: code, name, lot, dates (fabrication, validity, entry, exit)
   - Flexible unit system: kg or boxes with configurable weight per box
   - Temperature and shelf-life requirements
   - JSONB column for alert configurations:
     - Days to count from fabrication
     - 1/3 validity warning toggle
     - Pop-up notification preferences
   - Foreign key to users for tracking who registered each product

3. **audit_log** table:
   - Comprehensive operation tracking (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE, SAIDA)
   - Stores product code and name for reference even after deletion
   - JSON field for detailed change data
   - Links to users and timestamps for full traceability

**Data Validation**: Zod schemas shared between client and server via the `@shared` directory

**Computed Fields**: Client-side calculation of:
- Inspection date based on fabrication + configured days
- Status (VENCIDO, VENCE EM BREVE, ATIVO) based on expiration
- Alert level (AMARELO, NENHUM) based on 1/3 validity rule
- Total weight considering unit type and quantity

### External Dependencies

**Database Service**: 
- Neon Postgres (serverless PostgreSQL)
- WebSocket support via `ws` package for Neon's serverless driver
- Connection pooling via @neondatabase/serverless

**UI Component Libraries**:
- Radix UI primitives (accordion, dialog, dropdown-menu, select, toast, etc.)
- Lucide React for icons
- date-fns for date manipulation and formatting (with pt-BR locale)

**Development Tools**:
- Replit-specific plugins (@replit/vite-plugin-runtime-error-modal, cartographer, dev-banner)
- TypeScript for type safety across the stack
- ESLint for code quality

**Build & Bundling**:
- Vite for frontend bundling and dev server
- esbuild for backend bundling
- PostCSS with Tailwind and Autoprefixer

**File Processing**:
- xlsx (SheetJS) for Excel import/export
- adm-zip for potential file compression

**Authentication & Sessions**:
- bcryptjs for password hashing
- express-session for session management
- memorystore for in-memory session storage (note: not production-ready for multi-instance deployments)

**Path Aliases**: 
- `@/` maps to `client/src/`
- `@shared/` maps to `shared/`
- `@assets/` maps to `attached_assets/`

client/src/components/ui/checkbox.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as CheckboxPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-checkbox"
import { Check } from "lucide-react"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Checkbox = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <CheckboxPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "peer h-4 w-4 shrink-0 rounded-sm border border-primary ring-offset-background focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 data-[state=checked]:bg-primary data-[state=checked]:text-primary-foreground",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator
      className={cn("flex items-center justify-center text-current")}
    >
      <Check className="h-4 w-4" />
    </CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator>
  </CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
))
Checkbox.displayName = CheckboxPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Checkbox }

client/src/components/ui/navigation-menu.content:
import * as React from "react" import * as NavigationMenuPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-navigation-menu" import { cva } from "class-variance-authority" import { ChevronDown } from "lucide-react" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" const NavigationMenu = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => ( {children} )) NavigationMenu.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Root.displayName const NavigationMenuList = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => ( )) NavigationMenuList.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.List.displayName const NavigationMenuItem = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Item const navigationMenuTriggerStyle = cva( "group inline-flex h-10 w-max items-center justify-center rounded-md bg-background px-4 py-2 text-sm font-medium transition-colors hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground focus:bg-accent focus:text-accent-foreground focus:outline-none disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 data-[state=open]:text-accent-foreground data-[state=open]:bg-accent/50 data-[state=open]:hover:bg-accent data-[state=open]:focus:bg-accent" ) const NavigationMenuTrigger = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => ( {children}{" "} )) NavigationMenuTrigger.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Trigger.displayName const NavigationMenuContent = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => ( )) NavigationMenuContent.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Content.displayName const NavigationMenuLink = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Link const NavigationMenuViewport = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) NavigationMenuViewport.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Viewport.displayName const NavigationMenuIndicator = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) NavigationMenuIndicator.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Indicator.displayName export { navigationMenuTriggerStyle, NavigationMenu, NavigationMenuList, NavigationMenuItem, NavigationMenuContent, NavigationMenuTrigger, NavigationMenuLink, NavigationMenuIndicator, NavigationMenuViewport, }

shelf-aid-63463-18583-48609-54635-37544-.content:
# Welcome to your Lovable project

## Project info

**URL**: https://lovable.dev/projects/a2d8b043-45fd-405b-994b-ba19b22a8d52

## How can I edit this code?

There are several ways of editing your application.

**Use Lovable**

Simply visit the [Lovable Project](https://lovable.dev/projects/a2d8b043-45fd-405b-994b-ba19b22a8d52) and start prompting.

Changes made via Lovable will be committed automatically to this repo.

**Use your preferred IDE**

If you want to work locally using your own IDE, you can clone this repo and push changes. Pushed changes will also be reflected in Lovable.

The only requirement is having Node.js & npm installed - [install with nvm](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm#installing-and-updating)

Follow these steps:

```sh
# Step 1: Clone the repository using the project's Git URL.
git clone <YOUR_GIT_URL>

# Step 2: Navigate to the project directory.
cd <YOUR_PROJECT_NAME>

# Step 3: Install the necessary dependencies.
npm i

# Step 4: Start the development server with auto-reloading and an instant preview.
npm run dev
```

**Edit a file directly in GitHub**

- Navigate to the desired file(s).
- Click the "Edit" button (pencil icon) at the top right of the file view.
- Make your changes and commit the changes.

**Use GitHub Codespaces**

- Navigate to the main page of your repository.
- Click on the "Code" button (green button) near the top right.
- Select the "Codespaces" tab.
- Click on "New codespace" to launch a new Codespace environment.
- Edit files directly within the Codespace and commit and push your changes once you're done.

## What technologies are used for this project?

This project is built with:

- Vite
- TypeScript
- React
- shadcn-ui
- Tailwind CSS

## How can I deploy this project?

Simply open [Lovable](https://lovable.dev/projects/a2d8b043-45fd-405b-994b-ba19b22a8d52) and click on Share -> Publish.

## Can I connect a custom domain to my Lovable project?

Yes, you can!

To connect a domain, navigate to Project > Settings > Domains and click Connect Domain.

Read more here: [Setting up a custom domain](https://docs.lovable.dev/features/custom-domain#custom-domain)

client/src/components/ui/scroll-area.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as ScrollAreaPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-scroll-area"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const ScrollArea = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn("relative overflow-hidden", className)}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport className="h-full w-full rounded-[inherit]">
      {children}
    </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport>
    <ScrollBar />
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Corner />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
))
ScrollArea.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root.displayName

const ScrollBar = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
>(({ className, orientation = "vertical", ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar
    ref={ref}
    orientation={orientation}
    className={cn(
      "flex touch-none select-none transition-colors",
      orientation === "vertical" &&
        "h-full w-2.5 border-l border-l-transparent p-[1px]",
      orientation === "horizontal" &&
        "h-2.5 flex-col border-t border-t-transparent p-[1px]",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaThumb className="relative flex-1 rounded-full bg-border" />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
))
ScrollBar.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar.displayName

export { ScrollArea, ScrollBar }

client/src/components/ui/progress.tsx.content:
"use client"

import * as React from "react"
import * as ProgressPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-progress"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Progress = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, value, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ProgressPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative h-4 w-full overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ProgressPrimitive.Indicator
      className="h-full w-full flex-1 bg-primary transition-all"
      style={{ transform: `translateX(-${100 - (value || 0)}%)` }}
    />
  </ProgressPrimitive.Root>
))
Progress.displayName = ProgressPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Progress }
